direction.raw_text: Yeah,, it goes up a little and then it goes down, maybe Nixon will do something. What's the difference, they're all a bunch of jerks. I wouldn't let 'em run my business, I can tell you that much. Not if I had any choice in the matter. (after a moment) I don't know what to do with you. I don't know, I don't know what's right or wrong anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't either, Lester, I swear to you I don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (suddenly) What about Jackie?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean, how did that happen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lester, it just happened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's nothing but a whore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No -- LESTER Just a whore, I go over there, have a few drinks and get my gun off. I'm through with her, she's nothing but a whore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, man, no. You can say everybody's a whore. She's okay. I mean Jackie'll fuck around but not that much. Somewhere she really likes you, Lester, and it's not just the bread. She's okay. Lester sits and thinks about that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You really think so?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes I do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm finished with her. Lester goes to the door. He turns as if he'd just thought of something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, by the way, I think you oughta know -- Lorna thinks she's got the clap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, the clap. That's what she thinks. But who knows -- I don't know. George nods. Lester shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know anything anymore. He opens the door and goes out. The two hoods are standing there. They look to Lester.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to hoods) Go easy on him, he's a nice boy. George looks shocked. Lester laughs, gives George a playful punch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just having a little fun, George... (to hoods) Go on home. (to George) I'll call you later about the shop. I'm beat. God, I'm beat. With that, Lester's off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pulls up. He goes into the shop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Norman is by the front desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're late, George.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Devra, try Jackie Shawn will you? And if you don't reach her, keep trying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (on desk) Mrs. Shumann and Mrs. Young are waiting. Mrs. Young is kind of p.o.'d. George nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Mary?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hasn't showed up yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (grumbling something under his breath, then:) Norman! (to Devra) Devra, I asked you to call Jackie. Call her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (perturbed) All right. Norman from upstairs shouts down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somebody's going to have to wash Mrs. Young. Mary's not here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he's had about enough) Look, Norman, I'm not the shampoo girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are today. George starts to say something but he's tired. He goes to his corner, slams his jacket down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Temper, temper, George. George fiddles around with the shampoos and rinses, knocks over one where the top was not on, and the shampoo spills all over the table top and starts to drip on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Jesus, that fucking goddam Mary- He starts to look for a rag and sees that Mary, wearing a cloth coat is coming into the shop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary! Get over here! Mary moves very slowly, George waits, hands on hips. It should almost be a little faggy, his petulance as if, inevitably some of the shop must rub off on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary, where were you yesterday? Huh? Mary doesn't answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ran out on me and you left it like a goddamn pig pen. Mary's swaying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong, Mary, are you drunk? Look, I've had a rough night, one of the roughest I've ever had, now I'm not in the mood for any sulking bullshit, what's wrong? Are you sick? Are you drunk? Can you work?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Otis is dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Otis? She points to his picture on the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My son Otis. He was killed in Vietnam. They done phoned me at the shop yesterday. It's suddenly very quiet. The SOUND of the SHAMPOO DRIPPING on the floor can be HEARD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Mary. Mary starts to cry and like a little child buries her head on George's shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: you shouldn't talk to me like that no matter what, George... you know better...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: oh -- sweetheart...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: you shouldn't do me like that...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (hugging her)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: please, please forgive me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (crying)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: you know better...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (after a moment)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: why did you come in today?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: left my bag, didn't have no money...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: how did you get here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: took a bus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: c'mon, I'll get you home...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on his cycle drives up Bowmont into Jackie's driveway. Her car is there. George jumps off his bike, fairly races to the door. It's open and he barges in. He's met by Jackie's Yorkies who bark furiously, jumping up and down, nipping his pantlegs for attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: just a minute, you're early -- Jackie comes walking out. She's carrying a large cooking spoon and wears an apron over a travelling outfit, a pantsuit. She's wearing more makeup than usual. She stops when she sees George.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: good afternoon -- JACKIE -- you've got to leave. George is not prepared for this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got to leave?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: yes, honey, you've got to get out of here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lester's on his way. George stares at her then walks past her into the living room. Bags are packed, a coat thrown over them. The wire kennel carrying cages for the Yorkies are beside the bags. George looks into the kitchen where Jackie's been cooking some pasta.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are you going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, we'll have to talk later -- GEORGE Look about last night -- JACKIE (exasperated but not unkind) Forget about last night, it's okay, we'll talk when I get back -- GEORGE It's not okay, I mean we've got to talk now. Where are you going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look -- either you leave or I leave because I don't want the two of us here when Lester arrives. I just don't -- The level of her nervousness has just risen about fifty decibels. There's the SOUND of a CAR outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My God that's him -- George looks out the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Malone's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's it, then I'm leaving. With that she tosses the spoon onto an end table and rushes out the door. George starts after her. The DRY CLEANER comes to the door, stopping George.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cleaners. George has to fumble with Jackie's cleaning and keep the dogs contained. He does, tosses the cleaning down and races outside to his bike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: he sees Jackie's car rounding the corner, going up the hill, winding around the curves. George guns his bike and takes off after her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - GEORGE almost sideswipes a car parked on a hairpin turn. Jackie's on the curve above him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - GEORGE catches up with her, pulls even to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pull over, pull over! He threatens to run her into the curb. She stops the car sharply and jumps out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They've reached a cul de sac where there's a parched 'view lot' not built on. Yellow October weeds cover it and there's a huge television antenna in its center which sways slightly in an afternoon wind. Jackie has run onto the lot, then slows to a walk. She grabs one of the rusty stays of the swaying antennas, stares down below her. Her house can be seen from this angle, the Malone's truck just pulling away. George comes up to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looking below her) You're going to kill me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No -- JACKIE (turning to him, imploring) Well then what are you trying to do-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to marry you. I want to take care of you and I want your children, and I want you to be my girl. That's all I want. That's all I want out of my life, and it's a lot. She stares at him in disbelief. She actually clutches her stomach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I don't know if I'll ever make it. I mean I'm a fuckup, but I'll take care of you, I'll make you happy, I swear to God I will. Jackie doesn't answer. She slowly sinks to the ground. George sinks beside her. Her eyes are wet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jackie... Jackie?... answer me, for God's sake, answer me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you knew how many times I wanted to hear you say that...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So I'm saying it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's too late...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's too late about it? Look, we're not dead, are we? That's the only thing that's too late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lester's left Felicia. He's taking me to Acapulco on the five o'clock flight. He's asked me to marry him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what? You don't love him, do you? Answer me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that supposed to mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know... Jackie?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? George now is very near tears himself. What he says now he has to force out of himself, as if it's the biggest secret he holds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't trust... anyone... but you... George lets his head fall on her shoulder. She's kneeling, supported by the television aerial, and George cries quietly on her shoulder. She has her arm around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my baby... As she's holding George, and looking down the hill, Lester's silver Rolls pulls up. Lester gets out of the car, goes to the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God, there's Lester...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't go, Jackie...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't just let him stand by the door...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't leave me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got to... I've got to tell him where I am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know -- I've got to. She gets up and hurries over to her car, starts it and goes back down the hill. George sits under the television aerial and watches her car go down the hill, periodically flashing
direction.name: direction

result.heading: AT THE TOP OF THE DRIVE
